intro: Proiphys kimberleyensis, commonly known as the Kimberley proiphys, is a flowering plant native to the Kimberley region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in the region.
